quotes.quote: Law is merely the expression of the will of the strongest for the time being, and therefore laws have no fixity, but shift from generation to generation.
[http://www.whitings-writings.com/diatribes/ehe01.htm The Economics of Human Energy in Brooks Adams, Ezra Pound and Robert Theobald]
[http://www.archive.org/details/lawcivilization00adamgoog Brooks Adams, The Law of Civilization and Decay: An Essay on History, Macmillan & co., ltd., 1896]
[http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=3631 Brooks Adams at Find a grave.]
